result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb Isaac McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 6 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or similar Class B establishments that sell alcohol.

The defendant may not have any contact in any form with victim (R.M.)
The defendant must undergo an anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must maintain/obtain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Caleb Isaac McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:23 AM. State - resolved - amend count #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1) - plead G/NC, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of $500 fine plus costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar type establishments unless for work related purposes only, school/empoloyment, 50 hours of community service, no contact with victim (R.M.) - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response or VIS. Voorhees and McGeshick agree and provides court with plea questionnaire but asks for additional community service for payment of fine. Court amends only count to misdemeanor battery contrary to 940.19(1) with PTAC following. McGeshick pleads G thru plea questionnaire form. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees - follow joint recommendation - again asks for community service for payment of fine. State does object to community service for payment of fines for stated reasons but defers to the Clerk. Clerk instruts Court of the fine payment procedures in Forest County - either paid thru probation, civil judgment at end of probation or payment plan. McGeshick withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs totalling $1083.50 - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or similar Class B establishments  that sell alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 50 hours of community service, no contact in any form with victim (R.M.), submit DNA sample, credit for 6 days credit only if revoked (stipulated) right to appeal, adjourned.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Caleb Isaac McGeshick in court with attorney John E Voorhees.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:10 PM. State calls Deputy William Voss. Vorhees requests sequestration of witnesses. Court so orders. Voss sworn in at 1:11 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:20 PM). Cross exam by Vorhees at 1:21 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (1:23 PM). State objects - relevance - explanation by Vorhees - overruled for stated reasons (1:26 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained (1:29 PM). Re-direct by State at 1:29 PM. Court has questions of witness. Witness excused at 1:30 PM. State has no other witnesses. Vorhees has no witnesses. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Vorhees has Information, requests short recess to confer with his client (1:31 PM). Back on record at 1:47 PM with same appearances. Vorhees files Request for Substitution. State - bond - no objections to continuing bond. Court continues bond and accepts RFS as timely.
No consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (RM) and not to have other individuals contact the victim either, no contact with Shonda Poler and no contact with Brett Landru.

Defendant Caleb Isaac McGeshick in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO with attorney John E Voorhees appearing in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:57 AM. Voorhees has complaint and has been provided a copy for the defendant but does not believe the defendant has one yet. McGeshick does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. McGeshick and Voorhees understand charges and penalties. Voorhees waives further reading, requests PH but would like to address bond. Voorhees - bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons with same conditions and possible no contact with co-defendants and no consumption of alcohol. State - bond - no objections to signature bond would like a no contact provision with Shonda Poler, Brett Landru or the victim (RM) and no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond - amends bond to $2000.00 signature, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (RM) and not to have other individuals contact the victim either, no contact with Shonda Poler and no contact with Brett Landru. Voorhees will now waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived and sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (RM)
